msDesc.head: Theological and pastoral miscellany; A-E Germany (in part Erfurt), 15th century, middle (in part 1444)

physDesc.p: Composite: five manuscripts, the fifth in turn made up of four 'booklets'; together early.

binding.p: Contemporary binding of whittawed skin on boards, sewn on four double/split bands, ruled, and stamped with an eagle bearing the words 'Scs [?] Iohannes'; cf. Einbanddatenbank s009698, s010366 (workshop of Johannes Helmstatt, Erfurt, w000841). 4+1 bosses lost on each cover; clasps (fastening on the front board) lost. Tab bookmarks. Contents label on the front cover.

physDesc.accMat: A narrow reinforcement strip before fol. 426 is almost certainly from a 14th-century manuscript of Dante's Monarchia, with the commentary attributed to Cola da Rienzo; cf. faint offsets on fol. 427v and the back pastedown. More substantial fragments of the same manuscript are in MS. Hamilton 13, q.v.

history.provenance: Erfurt, Carthusians: 15th-century ex libris, front and back pastedowns; identifiable as E 19 in the late-medieval catalogue (Mittelalterliche Bibliothekskataloge Deutschlands und der Schweiz, II: Erfurt, ed. P. Lehmann (1928), p. 333); early-modern ex libris, fol. 1.
Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow, 1760-?1831: identifiable as 103 in the catalogue of his sale, 1836.
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford (May 2020, rev. March 2021). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 19 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 20

listBibl.head: Online resources:

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: Balázs József Nemes, Bibliotheca Cartusiae Erfordiensis : Dokumentation über den überlieferten Buchbestand der Erfurter Kartause, 3., korrigierte und erweiterte Version (2022) DOI: 10.6094/UNIFR/223370

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Andrew G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c. 435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (1984), no. 498 (on fols. 1–298)

msItem.note: A fifteenth-century table of contents is pasted on to the upper pastedown. Underneath is pasted a separate piece with an extract from Ps.-Augustine, De dignitate sacerdotum, here attributed to 'Bernhardus' beg. 'O veneranda sacerdotum dignitas, in quorum manibus' (cf. GW 02947).

msItem.author: Thomas de Argentina
msItem.title: Commentary on Peter Lombard, Sentences, book IV
msItem.rubric: Thomas de argentina circa quartum sentenciarum [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Circa materiam quarti libri sentenciarium Queritur primo ut 4 sacramenta noue legis
msItem.explicit: lectoribus perducere dignetur ipse glorificator sanctorum qui vivit et regnat in secula seculorum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit lectura 4ti libri sententiarum venerabilis doctoris fratris Thome de Argentina ordinis fratrum heremitarum sancti Augustini.
msItem.colophon: Scripta & completa in studio Erffordensi anno Domini 1444to.
msItem.note: Much of fol. 38r, and fol. 38v blank; fol. 173vb blank; fol. 191v blank.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: bull's head with 6-pointed star (fols. 1–12, 39–86, 110–191, cf. Piccard Ochsenkopf VII.545, 547); dreiburg with Latin cross (fols. 13–38, 87–98); ox (type Piccard Vierfüssler VI.935–1029, fols. 177–8)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 46–53 lines. Frame-ruled in ink, ruled space 225–30 150–60 ; written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Cursive, apparently two hands, (a) fols. 1ra-5va, (b) fols. 5va-191rb

decoDesc.decoNote: Space for a 10-line initial at the beginning, not filled in.

msItem.author: Gregory the Great
msItem.title: De cura pastorali
msItem.incipit: Pastoralis cure me pondera
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber pastoralis beati Gregorii pape deo gracias anno domini etc. xliiij
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 227ra-b and fol. 227v blank.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: bull's head with cross and seven-petalled flower (fols. 192–203: type Piccard Ochsenkopf XI.329, cf. WZIS DE4860-Ms_619_176); dreiburg with Latin cross (fols. 204–227).

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 49–53 lines. Frame-ruled in ink, ruled space c. 230 145

decoDesc.decoNote: 2- to 4-line plain red initials, that on fol. 192r with simple arabesque decoration.

history.origin:
Germany, perhaps (as parts A, C) Erfurt
1444 (colophon, fol. 227r)

msItem.rubric: Tractatulus utilis pro cleris pro exhortando ad studium sacrarum litterarum [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Sacerdotibus necessaria est sciencia et maxime theologica que sufficienter illuminat, et quicquid alibi queritur in ea fructuosius invenitur. Nam sacerdotes populi sunt ductores, ideoque oportet ut clare videant ne simul cadant
msItem.explicit: Ut deus noster audiat nos orantes, et in futurum non audiatis uerbum asperum audicionem malam, Ite maledicti in ignem eternum, sed dulciter uerbum et suaue, Venite benedicti patris mei possidete paratum vobis regnum a constitutione mundi, Mt 25, Quod nobis omnibus tribuat deus noster iesus christus qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuit et regnat trius et vnus deus per omnia secula seculorum Amen. Et tantum de articulo quarto.
msItem.note: Later marginal headings 'de commendacione studii litterarum' (fol. 229r), 'item de modo studendi' (fol. 229v), 'qualis esse debeat vita clerici suie sacerdotis' (fol. 231v), 'de consuetudine mala' (fol. 234v), 'an et quomodo prelati possint argui ab inferioribus' (fol. 235r). This seems to be identifiable as the Collatio in introitu of Heinrich Toke ('Collatio magistri et doctoris Hinrici Token, quam fecit in introitu ad lecturam suam in ecclesie Magdeburgensi', Wolfenbüttel, HAB, Cod. Guelf. 83. 5 Aug. 2o, fols. 238–248; Hildegund Hölzel, Heinrich Toke und der Wolfenbütteler 'Rapularius' (Hannover, 1998), 21, 42–4).
Followed (fol. 237va-b) by a note that saints did not long for ecclesiastical preferment: 'Non legimus in sanctorum exemplis quod ipsi ad sacros ordines uel ecclesiasticas dignitates anhelabant ...'

msItem.author: Henricus de Hassia senior (?)
msItem.title: Tractatus de proprietate religiosorum
msItem.rubric: Tractatus magistri Henrici de Hassia de monachis proprietarijs
msItem.incipit: Pro salute eorum qui vicia fugere cupiunt cum ad veritatis viam fuerint reformati
msItem.colophon: Explicit tractatus magistri Henrici de hassia de monachis proprietarijs anno domini 1444 in vigilia sancte Margarethe

msItem.author: Matthew of Cracow
msItem.title: De squaloribus Romanae curiae
msItem.rubric: Libellus Mathei de Cracouia Episcopi Wormaciensis de Swaloribus curie papalis [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Moyses factus tamquam solitudinis amicus
msItem.explicit: precio comparabat. Benedictus sit dominus deus noster in secula seculorum Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit libellus doctoris Mathei de Crac. episcopi Warmacensis de swaloribus curie papalis
msItem.colophon: Editus erfordie conscriptus et finitus anno domini 1444 in Vigilia Marie Magdalene

msItem.rubric: Confessionale dans modum confitendi & audiendi confessiones [later hand]
msItem.incipit: In principio incarnacionisnarracionis nostre illius gratiam et adiutorium imploro
msItem.explicit: votis omnibus deprecor et exoro. Quod nobis prestare dignetur

msItem.incipit: Querunt quoque multi cur deus faceret hominem que posset peccare uel qui esset dampnaturus
msItem.explicit: boni per malos exercitantur et probantur
msItem.note: Extract from Hugo Ripelinus, Compendium theologicae ueritatis, II.65

msItem.incipit: Nota quod circa corpus christi quinque obiciunt nobis iudei. Primo de quantitate, dicentis Cum immensus deus
msItem.note: Cf. Thüringer Universitäts- und Landesbibliothek, MS. Klosterbibl. 5, fol. 82.

msItem.rubric: Summula de penitentia multum bona pro quolibet sacerdote
msItem.incipit: De dampnatis habetur Mathei xxv Discedite a me maledicti in ignem eternum
msItem.explicit: ad officium gloriose uirginis marie debet dari signum breuiter tantum.

msItem.author: Henricus de Hassia senior
msItem.title: Sermo de proprietate
msItem.rubric: Sermo bonus Henrici de Hassia de moribus et vita ad canonicos regulares [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Ecce reliquimus omnia et secuti sumus te Nouistis frates dilectissimi in domino iesu regulariter congregati, quorum sunt uerba hec
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo bonus de moribus et vita ad canonicos regulares Reuerendo viro magistro Heynrico de Hassia collectus. Incipit tractatus de proprietarij etc.

msItem.title: Compendium de statu religiosorum moderni temporis (Tractatus contra proprietarios)
msItem.rubric: Item alius tractatus bonus De proprietarijs Qui in concilio Constanciensi fuit promulgatus [later hand]
msItem.incipit: Venerabilissimo in christo patri ac domino domino Cistercii Ceterisque doctoribus et prelatis ordinis nostri cistercii
Pro euidenti et necessaria salute animarum nostrarum querimus utrum uel quomodo abbates uel monachi
msItem.explicit: crescunt discordie. Primum ergo querite regnum dei et iusticia eius et hec omnia adicientur vobis etc
msItem.finalRubric: Terminatur hic compendium religiosorum moderni temporis de anno videlicet Domini 1415 in consilio constanciensi promulgatum etc. Sit laus et gloria.
msItem.bibl: Extracts pr. Acta Concilii Constanciensis IV (1928), 671–6; for manuscripts see James D. Mixson, Poverty's Proprietors: Ownership and Mortal Sin at the Origins of the Observant Movement (Leiden, 2009), 99–100 and n. 14, and appendix, nos. 29 and 10 (distinguishing two recensions); additional copies include Historisches Archiv der Stadt Köln, GB 4º 97, 115r-126r; 8º 56, 104r-132r; Weimar, Herzogin Anna Amalia Bibliothek, Q 22 fols. 69r-80v.

msItem.author: Ps.-Albertus Magnus
msItem.title: Paradisus animae
msItem.rubric: Tractatus de virtutibus paradisus anime intytulatus [later hand?]
msItem.incipit: Sunt quedam vicia que frequenter
msItem.explicit: quia omnes vnite sunt in gratia. Quam nobis concedat qui sine fine viuit et regnat
msItem.colophon: Scriptus anno incarnacionis domini 1444 in die sancte Lucie virginis
msItem.note: A table of the 43 chapters precedes, fol. 282rb. Fol. 298b blank.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: bull's head with cross and seven-petalled flower (same as part B, fols. 192–203)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 50 lines. Frame-ruled in ink, ruled space 245 145

msItem.author: Jordanus de Quedlinburg
msItem.title: Meditatio de passione Christi
msItem.rubric: (fol. 299ra) Rubrica in speculum saluatoris passionis domini nostri ihesu christi
(fol. 299va) Speculum passionis Saluator nostri iesu christi. Incipit Jordanus de passione christi
msItem.incipit: Inspice et fac secundum exemplar Et si christus vbique in scriptura dicatur mons ratione summitatis siue excelentissime perfectionis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Jordanus de Passione Domini per manum friderici de lichtenfelss
msItem.note: Preceded by a table of contents. Fol. 342v blank.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: bull's head with cross and seven-petalled flower (same as part B, fols. 192–203)

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 40–42 lines. Frame-ruled in blind, verticals only, ruled space 220 150

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida by one hand, Fridericus de Lichtenfelss (fl. 1438–57) (colophon, fol. 342r); a professional scribe, for whom see Colophons nos. 4482–6, and H. Hauke, D. Kudorfer, E. Remak-Honnef, Die Handschriften aus St. Emmeram in Regensburg ; Bd. 1. Clm 14000–14130, Katalog der lateinischen Handschriften der Bayerischen Staatsbibliothek München, Bd.: 2,2,1,[a], (1995), p. 93 (on Clm 14041).

decoDesc.decoNote: 2-line plain red initials, unfilled from fol. 310r onwards.

msItem.title: Sermones epistolares de sanctis
msItem.note: Schneyer I.550–553, nos. 647–9 (S79). Part of fol. 367va blank; 367vb blank.

msItem.author: Henricus de Frimaria
msItem.title: Expositio passionis dominicae

rubric.add: Sermo henrici de frimaria de passione domini

msItem.incipit: Qvia nichil est vtilius nichil salubrius quam circa passionem dominicam occupare
Circa primum nota quod sicud refert Math. Christus erat in bethania
msItem.explicit: graciam sepeliri et iugiter conseruari. Quod nobis prestare dignetur qui benedictus est in secula. Amen.

msItem.author: Matthew of Cracow (?)
msItem.title: De passione domini

rubric.add: Sermo de passione domini prolixus et valde bonus ad predicandum

msItem.incipit: Circa inicium passionis domini nostri iesu christi et declaracionem eiusdem est notandum primo quod tota historia passionis christi secundum omnes ewangelistas ad sex puncta reducitur. Primus ostendit quomodo iesus christus fuit venditus et traditus

Quantum ergo ad primum et inicium illius sacratissime passionis assumitur verbum quod scribitur Mt. xxvi Cum autem esset iesus in bethania in domo symonis leprosi etc. Et licet ista verba hodie scilicet quarta feria non leguntur, sed in die palmarum, tamen opera ista facta sunt hodie. Sed antequam dicatur aliquid de istis verbis, est sciendum quod dies hodierna appellatur teutunice die krumme mittewoghen

(fol. 378va) Scitis quia post biduum pasca fiet et filius hominis tradetur principibus sacerdotum (Matth. 26,2). Sed Mt dicit Collegerunt pontifices et pharisaei consilium etc. Vbi notandum quod pontifices
msItem.explicit: Sed quia modo est tempus renouacionis per penitenciam, et igitur per penitentiam renouemur et ut corpus christi posset in nobis quiescere et remanere. Ideo promandemus insistere [St. Pölten, Diözesanbibliothek, Hs 33, fol. 121ra reads 'pro nunc penitencie insistere debemus'] et nos a peccatis emendare, quod inquam corpus christi et viaticum viatores in gratia confirmet et ad terminum vie perducat qui terminus est ipse deus cuius filius vnigenitus est pro salute nostra passus, quod nobis prestat qui sine fine viuit et regnat amen
msItem.note: For the Expositio passionis or Concordancia ewangelistarum attributed variously to Matthew of Cracow, Matthias Hildebrandi of Legnicz, Nicholas Magnus of Jawor, and Mikołaj Ligatoris zw. Goleszko, see Clavis scriptorum et operum Medii Aevi Poloniae (2019), nos. 427/13 (p. 502), p. 551, 460/40 (p. 563), 492/3 (p. 621); Stegmüller, Bibl. 6002,1 and 9451; and cf. Stegmüller, Bibl. 8763. The present text begins as Stegmüller, Bibl. 5527,1 (attributed by Stegmüller, Bibl. to Matthew of Cracow, but apparently a Lectura on his text: see B. Michael, Die mittelalterlichen Handschriften der Wissenschaftlichen Stadtbibliothek Soest (1990), 92–3 on Soest Cod. 10; see also Ansbach SB MS. lat. 107 fols. 121ra-166va). For the ending cf. Stegmüller, Bibl. 8763.

msItem.title: Commentary on the Apostles' Creed (?)

rubric.add: Aliqua scripta detruncata tam a parte prima quam vltima Et declarantur in eis aliqui articuli fidei

msItem.incipit: Et mortuus est. Nunc consequenter proponit articulum fidei de ipsius morte
msItem.explicit: in quo est christus corporaliter et angeli cum eo ac anime beate, de quo celo

physDesc.p: An early unit, with quire numbers 7–9, 1–6 (presumably misbound in their current order), but with fols. 342–57, 358–67, 368–77, 378–437 forming distinct codicological units.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: (fols. 342–57) bull's head with six-pointed star (parallels c. 1430–5 in WZIS, and cf. Piccard Ochsenkopf XI.263); (fols. 358–67) bull's head, indistinct; (fols. 368–77) bull's head with six-pointed star, indistinct; (fols. 378–435) bull's head with ?six-pointed star (indistinct), bull's head with seven-petalled flower (type Piccard Ochsenkopf XII.578, c. 1427–35), (fol. 383) lily with ?fish below (cf. Piccard Lilie I.538–46, c. 1431–3)

layoutDesc.layout: Fols. 342r-357v, 2 cols., c. 38–41 lines, frame-ruled in ink, ruled space 215–30 150–5
Fols. 358r-367v, 2 cols. c. 44–7 lines, frame-ruled in ink, ruled space 225 135
Fols. 368r-377v, 1 col., c. 35–8 lines, frame-ruled in ink, ruled space 195–205 120 .
Fols. 378r-435v, 2 cols. c. 40–42 lines, frame-ruled in ink, ruled space 225 140

handDesc.handNote: Fols. 342r-357v: cursive, 2 hands, changing at fol. 353vb
Fols. 378r-435v: cursive, 2 hands, changing at fol. 416v.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fols. 342r-357v: space for a 6-line initial at the beginning (crudely filled later in black), for 2-line initials elsewhere.
Fols. 358r-367v: spaces left for a 5-line initial at the beginning, for 3-line initials elsewhere.
Fols. 368r-377v: spaces left for a 5-line initial at the beginning, for 3-line initials elsewhere.

revisionDesc.change: Additional physical description; revised account of structure; identification of art. 3.
